title: Computer-Supported Collaborative Learning (CSCL) for Mathematical Problem-Solving Processes in [Large-Scale] Settings

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts (operations, equations, functions)
context.additional_context: Learners Perform Collaborative Activities Using Personal Smartphones/Tablets, with Emphasis on Project-Based Learning Experiences for Solving Real-Life Problems

learning_goals: Complete at least two projects solving real-world math problems using collaborative learning patterns.
Perform complex math problem-solving processes at least three times through communication with peer learners.
Apply and evaluate five or more collaborative problem-solving strategies using digital tools.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
